revised_title: Thermal Effects of Drawing Out a Film of Liquid
tldr: The author investigates the thermal effects of drawing out a film of liquid, such as a soap bubble, and finds that the process results in a cooling effect. The cooling effect is caused by the absorption of heat at higher temperatures and the evolution of heat at lower temperatures, with the total energy of the matter increasing by a degree Centigrade when the film is drawn out to 16 square inches.
